product: Amazon.com: Customer reviews: Apple 2020 MacBook Air Laptop M1 Chip, 13” Retina Display, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD Storage, Backlit Keyboard, FaceTime HD Camera, Touch ID. Works with iPhone/iPad; Space Gray
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Impressed.
body: Long time iPhone user, but the first Apple computer I’ve owned. It has been really nice. No complaints. I can’t imagine most people needing anything bigger for storage if they have an affordable iCloud plan. Easier to use than I thought it would be (coming from using Windows for years). It’s just a iPad with a keyboard, with a few computer-like features added. You can go into the settings and disable most of the things that you don’t want and make it your own. Except for Chess… Why in the world Apple won’t allow you to delete that addicting game is beyond me. Pure evil on their part (lol).

product: Amazon.com: Customer reviews: Apple 2020 MacBook Air Laptop M1 Chip, 13” Retina Display, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD Storage, Backlit Keyboard, FaceTime HD Camera, Touch ID. Works with iPhone/iPad; Space Gray
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Superior screen
body: The screen is superior to any I've seen.  the touch pad is better than others I've used, but I'm used to a magic mouse, so it leaves something to be desired. (what doesn't?).  It needs a couple more USB ports.  Very portable.  Good battery life.

product: Amazon.com: Customer reviews: Apple 2020 MacBook Air Laptop M1 Chip, 13” Retina Display, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD Storage, Backlit Keyboard, FaceTime HD Camera, Touch ID. Works with iPhone/iPad; Space Gray
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Compact and quiet laptop
body: It's really surprising how cool the laptop is when you do light activities (browsing , listening to music, etc). I had no idea that some pages are loading so quick and I think this is related to the M1 processor and the optimizations in the OS.I still have reservations on the fact that the MacBook has no vents or fans to cool itself down.It get pretty hot when doing light gaming,so I would consider getting a cooling pad.One large drawback for me is the reduced ammount and type of ports. Thankfully the Macbook works quite well with a Dell docking station and I can take advantage of the ports on it.
